intro: Ridleyandra kiewii subsp. magnifica, commonly known as the giant ridge fern, is a striking species native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It is characterized by its large, robust fronds that can grow up to several meters in length, showcasing a unique combination of architectural complexity and aesthetic appeal. The plant belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its fronds are typically dark green and possess a velvety texture, with a distinctive midrib that runs the length of the leaf. This species is often found growing on tree trunks or in rocky crevices, demonstrating its adaptability to various microhabitats within its native range.
